Rotorsystem¶

This is the Rotorsystem class. This is the main class of the toolbox.

class +AMrotorSIM.@Rotorsystem.Rotorsystem(c, name)¶

Bases: handle

Rotorsystem is the basis class for a rotor system. R=ROTORSYSTEM(cnfg,’System’);

param c:cnfg-struct from seperat Config script
type c:matlab struct
param name:project name
type name:string
return:rotorsystem object
name = None¶

name of the rotorsystem

systemmatrices = None¶

in urspr�nglicher Form obsolet, wieder hinzugefuegt, damit die Zeitintegration erst einmal funktioniert. fuer speichern der systemloads

cnfg = 'struct([])'¶

configure struct, typically created in seperate Config _ script

rotor = None¶

See also AMrotorSIM.Sensors

sensors = None¶

See also AMrotorSIM.Loads

loads = None¶

See also AMrotorSIM.Components.Component

components = None¶

See also AMrotorSIM.pidControllers.pidController

pidControllers = None¶

See also AMrotorSIM.activeMagneticBearing

+AMrotorSIM.@Rotorsystem.assemble(obj)¶

+AMrotorSIM.@Rotorsystem.assemble_system_loads(self, time, Z)¶
+AMrotorSIM.@Rotorsystem.assemble_system_matrices(self, rpm, varargin)¶
+AMrotorSIM.@Rotorsystem.calculate_bearing_force(rotorsystem, time, displacement, velocity)¶

calculate the force of the sensor BearingForceSensor Uses the displacment and velocity to obtain the force of the corresponding bearings; does not use an inertia term Calculates the forces of the bearing acting ON the rotor: F_bearing = - (k*x + d*x_dot)

+AMrotorSIM.@Rotorsystem.calculate_controller_force(rotorsystem, time, displacement, velocity)¶

calculate the force of the sensor ControllerForceSensor Uses the displacment and velocity to obtain the force of the corresponding pidControllers

+AMrotorSIM.@Rotorsystem.calculate_force_load_post_sensor(rotorsystem, time, displacement, velocity)¶

calculate the force of the sensor ForceLoadPostSensor Uses the displacment and velocity to obtain the force of the corresponding load-objects, through their force laws

+AMrotorSIM.@Rotorsystem.check_for_non_integrable_components(self)¶

CHECK_FOR_NON_INTEGRABLE_COMPNENTS Summary of this function goes here Input of class Rotorsystem

+AMrotorSIM.@Rotorsystem.check_overall_translational_mass(self, U)¶

+AMrotorSIM.@Rotorsystem.compute_system_load_ss(self, t, Z)¶

compute the system load in state space form for time integration: h=[0;F]

+AMrotorSIM.@Rotorsystem.find_state_vector(self, position, Z)¶

only for state-space in the form u = [x; x_dot]
